intro: Ochyrorchis cavatibrachia, commonly known as the hollow-bract orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to the mountainous regions of New Guinea. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a long, slender spur that extends from the base of the flower. The plant produces small, delicate flowers with a distinctive purple or pink coloration, often with intricate patterns on the petals. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is typically found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Ochyrorchis cavatibrachia is considered a conservation concern.
